required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COREG MR Versus TOPROL-XL On The Lipid Profile Of Normolipidemic Or Mildly Dyslipidemic Patients With Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center Study Comparing the Effects of Carvedilol Phosphate Modified Release Formulation (COREG- MR) With Metoprolol Succinate (TOPROL XL) on the Lipid Profile in Normolipidemic, or Mildly Dyslipidemic Hypertensive Patients

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to determine whether treatment with COREG MR is more effective at maintaining a better lipid profile than treatment with TOPROL-XL for hypertension.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Triglycerides Levels by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
primary_outcome.description: Blood draw for triglyceride levels. Full beta quantification test performed which uses ultracentrifugation to partially separate lipoprotein classes and is the basis for the reference methods. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) Levels by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
primary_outcome.description: Blood draw for HDL-C levels. Full beta Quant test performed with HDL subclasses. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Log Transformed High Sensitivity C-reactive Protein (Hs-CRP) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for hs-CRP. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Log Transformed Lipoprotein-associated Phospholipase A2 (LpPLA2) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for LpPLA2 activity. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Blood Pressure by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Manual physical examination (cuff blood pressure). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Heart Rate by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Manual physical examination. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value. (BPM=beats per minute)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Weight by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month
secondary_outcome.description: Manual physical examination. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Additional Lipid Parameters by Treatment Group With Unit of Measures of mg/dL at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for lipid levels. Full beta Quant test performed with HDL subclasses and IDL. IDL=Intermediate density lipoproteins, LDL=Low-density lipoprotein, VLDL=Very Low density lipoprotein, HDL=High-density lipoprotein. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Additional Lipid Parameters by Treatment Group With Unit of Measures of g/L at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for lipid levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Insulin (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in c-Peptide (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Homeostasis Model Assessment (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented history of hypertension
- Triglycerides of 120-400 mg/mL
- LDLc levels not requiring lipid lowering medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has known contraindication to alpha- or beta-blocker therapy.
- Has taken any non-ocular beta-blockers within three months before screening.
- Has Type I or II diabetes.
- Taking lipid lowering medications.

group.title: Coreg CR
group.description: Carvedilol Phosphate Extended Release 20 mg, 40 mg, and 80 mg Capsules QD (once daily)

group.title: Toprol XL
group.description: Metoprolol Succinate Extended Release 50 mg, 100 mg, and 200 mg Tablets QD (once daily)

group.title: Coreg CR
group.description: Carvedilol Phosphate Extended Release 20 mg, 40 mg, and 80 mg Capsules QD (once daily)

group.title: Toprol XL
group.description: Metoprolol Succinate Extended Release 50 mg, 100 mg, and 200 mg Tablets QD (once daily)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Triglycerides Levels by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
outcome.description: Blood draw for triglyceride levels. Full beta quantification test performed which uses ultracentrifugation to partially separate lipoprotein classes and is the basis for the reference methods. Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat (ITT-E) Population was used for analysis of the efficacy results and consisted of all subjects who randomized, received at least one dose of study medication, and had both a baseline and at least one on-therapy value for an efficacy parameter during the maintenance phase(number of participants will vary between measures).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Insulin (Glycemic Parameter) by Treatment Group at Maintenance Month 6
outcome.description: Blood draw for glycemia levels. Full beta Quant test performed. Test for Fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, fasting insulin. Homeostasis model Assessment (HOMA) is a computer-generated model consisting of non-linear empirical equations solved numerically to predict glucose, Insulin and C-peptide concentrations in fasting subjects for insulin sensitivity (%S). Change = Month 6 value minus Baseline value.
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat (ITT-E) Population was used for analysis of the efficacy results and consisted of all subjects who randomized, received at least one dose of study medication, and had both a baseline and at least one on-therapy value for an efficacy parameter during the maintenance phase(number of participants will vary between measures).

group.title: Coreg CR
group.description: Results include only treatment emergent events.

group.title: Toprol XL
group.description: Results include only treatment emergent events.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centres of a multi-centre trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
